009package GenericFilterDemos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel2D;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel2D;
017import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
018import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
019
020/**
021 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to construct a generic linear filter using the classes {@link LinearFilter} and
022 * {@link Kernel2D}. This plugin works for all types of images. On RGB color images, the filter is applied independently
023 * to the three color channels. The active image is modified.
024 *
025 * @author WB
026 * @see LinearFilter
027 * @see GenericFilter
028 * @see Kernel2D
029 * @see GaussianKernel2D
030 */
031public class Gaussian_Filter implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
032        
033        static double SIGMA = 3.0;
034
035    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
036        return DOES_ALL;
037    }
038
039    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {        
040                Kernel2D kernel = new GaussianKernel2D(SIGMA);
041                GenericFilter filter = new LinearFilter(kernel);
042                filter.applyTo(ip);
043    }
044
045}
